result.execSummary:
The defendant April Beatrice Frazier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. April Beatrice Frazier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • April Beatrice Frazier was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in 15CF262 and Count 2 in 15CF395 to run concurrent.
Count 1 dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than October 6, 2015 by 12:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports.
Court notes 107 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 1 15CF262

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF395.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF395.

-Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment.
-Apology letter to Victim E. Johnson within 30 days of this hearing and give to Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber & T. Gregory Amann, DF:  April Beatrice Frazier appeared. Court called at 3:15 p.m.   Includes case 15CF262 & 15CF395.   Set for PTC.   DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Victim E. J. makes statement.  Court addresses the victime.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF262 & Ct. 2 15CF395.  Guilty pleas are entered.  Court reviews the police reports attached to the Criminal Complaints.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF262 & Ct. 2 in 15CF395.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF262 & Ct. 1 in 15CF395. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF262 and to run concurrent with Ct. 2 15CF395 
- S/W and 2 years probation with conditions.
- 107 days credit for time served if revoked
- DE ordered to mental health evalutation and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- Court costs for Ct. 1 in 15CF262 of $268.00 and $250 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC (Not concurrent)
- Court costs for Ct. 2 in 15CF395 of $243.00 and $200 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC (Not concurrent)
- E.J. to receive $180.00 for restitution in 15CF262 
- Within 30 days of todays hearing the DE to write a letter of apology to E. J. and give to probation agent 
- DE to report to probation no later than 10/06/15 by 12:00 p.m. 
- Bail will continue in 15CF262 until the DE has signed up for probation and then will be vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference at 10-05-2015 03:00 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  April Beatrice Frazier appeared. Case called at 11:01 a.m. State has previously filed information.   Atty states def understands both charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Atty. Amann requests bond modification. State objects. Court continues bail. Adjourned 11:05 am  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by ADA Michael Nieskes. eif
for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence filed by Defendant. UNSIGNED. eif
Arraignment at 09-08-2015 11:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann, DF: April Beatrice Frazier appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:08 p.m. Set for Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Amann advises the court Attorney Weber may take over this case.  Set out for arraignment.  Attorney Amann asks the court to review the bond.  Bail is continued.  Court will grant a furlough for the DE for a funeral.  Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Appointing Atty Amann. km
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 01:00 pm

INCLUDES 15CF395 & 15CF262

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart,  Emily J., her residence/place of employment or Shawntell H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea for Julie Weber,  DF:  April Beatrice Frazier appeared from jail.  Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. ADA Hartung requests $2500.00 CB (on 15CF262) be reinstated, Atty Andrea argues. Request speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
